reactor.fn.timer

Class HashWheelTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.fn.timer.HashWheelTimer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Timer

    public class HashWheelTimer
extends Object
implements Timer
    Hash Wheel Timer, as per the paper: Hashed and hierarchical timing wheels: http://www.cs.columbia.edu/~nahum/w6998/papers/ton97-timing-wheels.pdf More comprehensive slides, explaining the paper can be found here: http://www.cse.wustl.edu/~cdgill/courses/cs6874/TimingWheels.ppt Hash Wheel timer is an approximated timer that allows performant execution of larger amount of tasks with better performance compared to traditional scheduling.
    Author:
    Oleksandr Petrov, Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini

    • Constructor Detail

      • HashWheelTimer

        public HashWheelTimer()
        Create a new HashWheelTimer using the given with default resolution of 100 milliseconds and default wheel size.

      • HashWheelTimer

        public HashWheelTimer(int resolution)
        Create a new HashWheelTimer using the given timer resolution. All times will rounded up to the closest multiple of this resolution.
        Parameters:
        resolution - the resolution of this timer, in milliseconds

      • HashWheelTimer

        public HashWheelTimer(int res,
                      int wheelSize,
                      HashWheelTimer.WaitStrategy waitStrategy)
        Create a new HashWheelTimer using the given timer and . All times will rounded up to the closest multiple of this resolution.
        Parameters:
        res - resolution of this timer in milliseconds
        wheelSize - size of the Ring Buffer supporting the Timer, the larger the wheel, the less the lookup time is for sparse timeouts. Sane default is 512.
        waitStrategy - strategy for waiting for the next tick

      • HashWheelTimer

        public HashWheelTimer(String name,
                      int res,
                      int wheelSize,
                      HashWheelTimer.WaitStrategy strategy,
                      Executor exec)
        Create a new HashWheelTimer using the given timer and . All times will rounded up to the closest multiple of this resolution.
        Parameters:
        name - name for daemon thread factory to be displayed
        res - resolution of this timer in milliseconds
        wheelSize - size of the Ring Buffer supporting the Timer, the larger the wheel, the less the lookup time is for sparse timeouts. Sane default is 512.
        strategy - strategy for waiting for the next tick
        exec - Executor instance to submit tasks to

      • schedule

        public Pausable schedule(Consumer<Long> consumer,
                         long period,
                         TimeUnit timeUnit,
                         long delayInMilliseconds)
        Description copied from interface: Timer
        Schedule a recurring task. The given Consumer will be invoked once every N time units after the given delay.
        Specified by:
        schedule in interface Timer
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer to invoke each period
        period - the amount of time that should elapse between invocations of the given Consumer
        timeUnit - the unit of time the period is to be measured in
        delayInMilliseconds - a number of milliseconds in which to delay any execution of the given Consumer
        Returns:
        a Pausable that can be used to cancel, pause or resume the given task.

        public Pausable schedule(Consumer<Long> consumer,
                         long period,
                         TimeUnit timeUnit)
